# init(code:userActivity:)

**Initializer**

Initializes the response object with the specified code and user activity object.

## Declaration

```swift
init(code: INStartCallIntentResponseCode, userActivity: NSUserActivity?)
```

## Parameters

- **code**: The response code that indicates your success or failure in confirming or handling the intent. For a list of possible values, see [doc://com.apple.sirikit/documentation/Intents/INStartCallIntentResponseCode].
- **userActivity**: The user activity object to use when launching your app. Provide an object if you want to add information that is specific to your app. If you specify `nil`, the system automatically creates a user activity object for you, sets its type to the class name of the intent being handled, and fills it with an [doc://com.apple.sirikit/documentation/Intents/INInteraction] object that contains the intent and your response.

## Return Value

An initialized response object or `nil` if unable to create the object.
title: init(code:userActivity:)
